snippet: The crane was being used to hoist a concrete counterweight when it stopped working properly.
abstract: Construction crane malfunctions on West 57th Street in Midtown Manhattan, at same  high-rise that was scene of crane accident during Hurricane Sandy; crane, hoisting concrete counterweight of more than 6 tons, stopped working properly, leaving load hanging about 30 stories above street for several hours.
lead_paragraph: The crane was being used to hoist a concrete counterweight when it stopped working properly.

headline.main: 57th Street Reopened After Crane Malfunction in Midtown
headline.print_headline: Crane Malfunctions at Tower, Site of Accident in Hurricane
